Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TroHepc2-22 (T. ovatus hepcidin2, Synthetic AMPs, Cyc-rich, XXA, XXE, 4S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: template modification, fish, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (81.82%) tohepcidin TH1-5C: 36%, G=R: 14%.Chemical modification: N-terminal acetylation and C-terminal amidation.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. agalactiae LFY-5 (MIC 16 uM), S. aureus ATCC6538 (MIC 8 uM), Gram- E. piscicida (MIC 32 uM), V. harveyi QT520 (MIC 16 uM), V. alginolyticus HN08155 (MIC 64 uM), and E.coli ATCC8739 (MIC 128 uM).Structure: predicted to be beta-sheet.MOA:bacteria: depolarized and permeabilized membranes of S. agalactiae, S. aureus, E. piscicida, and V. harveyi.
Literature Information.Author: Zhang Z, Zhou Y, Zhang H, Du X, Cao Z, Wu Y, Liu C, Sun Y. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2023 May 25;24(11):9251. doi: 10.3390/ijms24119251.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial Activity and Mechanisms of TroHepc2-22, a Derived Peptide of Hepcidin2 from Golden Pompano (Trachinotus ovatus).
